comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: ? David Carment nla.gov.au/nla.news-article28025680 ?? Justice Alfred Backhouse adb.anu.edu.au/biography/backhouse-alfred-paxton-44 I'm guessing! However, if you search the digitised newspapers you discover that both these chaps were prominent RSYS members. I'm ca. 60% convinced that we see Backhouse in this pic www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/8078318330/

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Again great work! I believe you are right about those guesses. Though this may not be the same day. Check out this work by Carment's great grandson!
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: If this were David Carment and Alfred Backhouse, then I'd say were also looking at their wives, ie. Elizabeth Carment (d. 1931) and Kate Backhouse (d. 1938). UPDATE...not Elizabeth Carment evidently...see comments at www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons/8204787408/

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: news.google.com/newspapers?id=O64oAAAAIBAJ&sjid=KpIDA... ...this October 1920 Sydney Mail pictorial has a pic of David Carment wearing what appears to be the same coat as the one he's wearing above, using ? the same binoculars, with what looks like the binocular case slung over his shoulder as we see above...not necessarily taken on the same occasion...but 1920 would be a good date for Alf Backhouse, who looks relatively young here...he looks much older in the Sam Hood pics taken in the 1930s which are in the SLNSW collection.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Haven't come across that one, a great find thank you quasymody! In any case, we could probably definitely say it is 1920s.
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
